metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3523 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in Linux Kernel. It has been classified as problematic. Affected is an unknown function of the file mm/memory.c of the component Driver Handler. The manipulation leads to use after free. It is possible to launch the attack remotely. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. The identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-211020.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3523` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic-64k - 6.1.0-16.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-aws - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-azure - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1004-gcp - 6.2.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-oracle - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1003-raspi - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-6.2.0-1003-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic-64k - 6.1.0-16.16
No subscription required
